name: Feta-Spinach Stuffed Salmon
author: ImpoverishedBlonde
summary: Simple, quick and delicious recipe. High protein. Love serving it with green beans and a baked potato for a special meal.
ingredients: ½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
1 (4 ounce) package crumbled feta cheese, or to taste
⅓ cup frozen chopped spinach -  thawed, drained, and squeezed dry
2 stalks scallions, white and green parts, thinly sliced
1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat a large baking dish with cooking spray
Combine cream cheese, feta cheese, spinach, and scallions in a small mixing bowl
Cut salmon fillet into 2 equal pieces
Brush the top of one piece with olive oil and place oiled side down in the prepared baking dish
Spread filling evenly over top; it will be about 3/4 inch thick
Place the second piece of salmon on the filling and brush the top with olive oil
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes evenly with a fork and filling is hot, 20 to 30 minutes
The time will depend on the size and weight of salmon used; check progress at 20 minutes to determine if additional baking time is needed
Remove from the oven and slice into 2 pieces to serve
